title: Particle motion, given acceleration part - c

content.description: A particle, initially at rest, moves along the x-axis so that its acceleration at any time t ≥ 0 is given by a(t) = 12t2−4 . The position of the particle when t=1 is x(1)=3 .
content.question: Find the total distance traveled by the particle from t=0 to t=2 .

frqParts.text: Find the total distance traveled by the particle from t=0 to t=2 .

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
